entry.title: https://github.com/facebook/infer
entry.content: A static analyzer for Java, C, C++, and Objective-C

entry.title: https://github.com/ocaml/opam
entry.content: opam is a source-based package manager. It supports multiple simultaneous compiler installations, flexible package constraints, and a Git-friendly development workflow.

entry.title: https://github.com/ocaml-ppx/ppxlib
entry.content: Base library and tools for ppx rewriters

entry.title: https://github.com/facebook/flow
entry.content: Adds static typing to JavaScript to improve developer productivity and code quality.

entry.title: https://github.com/dfinity/motoko
entry.content: Simple high-level language for writing Internet Computer canisters

entry.title: https://github.com/ocaml/dune
entry.content: A composable build system for OCaml.

entry.title: https://github.com/coq/coq
entry.content: Coq is a formal proof management system. It provides a formal language to write mathematical definitions, executable algorithms and theorems together with an environment for semi-interactive development of machine-checked proofs.

entry.title: https://github.com/engboris/transcendental-syntax
entry.content: Technical (but still naive, incomplete and unstable) interpretation of Girard's transcendental syntax

entry.title: https://github.com/terrateamio/terrateam
entry.content: Terrateam is an open-source GitOps CI/CD platform for automating infrastructure workflows. It integrates with GitHub to orchestrate Terraform, OpenTofu, CDKTF, and Terragrunt operations via pull requests.

entry.title: https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml
entry.content: The core OCaml system: compilers, runtime system, base libraries

entry.title: https://github.com/semgrep/semgrep
entry.content: Lightweight static analysis for many languages. Find bug variants with patterns that look like source code.
